info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 07 at 4:15AM EST until January 07 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Albany
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Snow will continue throughout the day. Additional snowfall accumulations of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts near 5 inches are expected. Accumulations totaling 10 to 14 inches with locally higher amounts near 16 inches in Ulster and Dutchess Counties are expected. Winds gusting as high as 30 to 40 mph in the higher terrain areas. * WHERE...Portions of northwestern Connecticut, western Massachusetts and mid Hudson Valley and eastern Catskills. * WHEN...Through 7 PM EST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult today due to snow covered roadways and reduced visibility. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Though unlikely, there is a non-zero probability of higher snowfall rates up to 0.5 inches per hour throughout the day which could reduce visibility.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency.
